meanings.definition: Those who do not believe in a particular religion or deity.
meanings.sent1: Nonbelievers often have different beliefs than religious people.
meanings.sent2: The nonbelievers in the group preferred not to participate in the prayer.
meanings.sent3: The nonbelievers jokingly referred to themselves as the 'unholy crew'.
meanings.sent4: In a world of believers, nonbelievers stand out like shadows in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The nonbelievers' skepticism towards religion was unwavering.

meanings.definition: People who lack faith or trust in something.
meanings.sent1: The nonbelievers in the team doubted the success of the project.
meanings.sent2: Nonbelievers in love often struggle to open their hearts to others.
meanings.sent3: The nonbelievers in the magic show were convinced that it was all just tricks.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of optimism, nonbelievers can be seen as realists.
meanings.sent5: The nonbelievers' lack of trust made them cautious in their decisions.
